item.title: ICE Is Causing a Health Crisis
item.description: Our patients face a cruel calculus: seek essential medical care and risk detention, or stay home and risk their lives.

item.title: The Best Moments So Far at the Winter Olympics
item.description: Three writers and an Olympic medalist on the grit and grace of the winter games.

item.title: The Year Empathy Died
item.description: Compassion is not toxic.

item.title: Who Would Win Gold in the Coward Olympics?
item.description: There are a lot of potential contestants.

item.title: The Future Is Indian
item.description: Why the next 30 years belong to a deal-making great power.

item.title: California Needs to Count Votes Faster
item.description: The slow counting of votes is a classic example of the perfect being the enemy of the good.

item.title: The Future Is Indian
item.description: Why the next 30 years belong to a deal-making great power.

item.title: Jesse Jackson Was a Style Icon
item.description: Mr. Jackson was never worried about looking like he worked at a bank.

item.title: President Trump Is a Wrecking Ball, and He’s Only Getting Started
item.description: As we lose our alliances and instability spreads, America is headed for more, not fewer, international entanglements.

item.title: Lessons for Democrats From Jesse Jackson’s Rainbow Populism
item.description: He spent his life trying to edify and repair our nation.

item.title: Democrats Win in Texas With Candidates Like Taylor Rehmet
item.description: A shock Democratic victory in a Texas special election shows what the party needs to do to win more there — and many other places, too.

item.title: The A.I. Disruption Has Arrived, and It Sure Is Fun
item.description: We’re entering a new renaissance of software development. We should all be excited, despite the uncertainties that lie ahead.

item.title: Marco Rubio Is Failing Western Civ
item.description: The Declaration of Independence’s powerful vision of equality stands as a chief obstacle to the MAGA right’s effort to consummate its vision of domination.

item.title: Why Public School Families Are Protesting Linda McMahon’s Visits
item.description: Linda McMahon is shocked — shocked! — that there’s been a backlash to the Department of Education’s ‘History Rocks!’ tour.

item.title: At the Olympics, a Real Heated Rivalry in Hockey
item.description: When the U.S. plays Canada in the Olympic women’s final, there will be much more than a gold medal at stake.

item.title: How We Resist ICE: Car Pools
item.description: In Minneapolis, people ignore the cold to defend their neighbors from ICE.

item.title: Kennedy’s MAHA Coalition Is a Mess
item.description: A political movement cannot survive on spite alone.

item.title: Netanyahu Plays Trump and American Jews for Fools — Again
item.description: Netanyahu has gotten Trump to focus on Iran and ignore the destructive things Bibi is doing in Gaza, in the West Bank and inside Israel.

item.title: He Studied Cognitive Science at Stanford. Then He Wrote a Startling Play About A.I. Authoritarianism.
item.description: A brisk theatrical thriller, “Data” perfectly captures the slick, grandiose language with which tech titans justify their potentially totalitarian projects.

item.title: When a Government Tracks Its Opponents
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security’s tracking of opponents of ICE. Also: Antislavery Americans; Native American pain; hazing laws; sympathy from Canada.

item.title: One Man Stole $660 Million. He’ll Never Pay It Back.
item.description: Ordinary citizens have a range of legal tools to hold the rich and politically connected accountable.

item.title: Has Trump Thrown the Democrats a Lifesaver?
item.description: The president appears determined to prevent his party from achieving a durable majority coalition.

item.title: Jesse Jackson’s Life and Legacy
item.description: Readers reflect on the passing of the civil rights leader. Also: Power serving the public; climate change and gravity.

item.title: What the American Right Wants From Europe
item.description: The tensions in Marco Rubio’s trans-Atlantic vision.

item.title: Western Civ Can Save Us — Again
item.description: Marco Rubio reminds an audience in Munich of what still unites us.

item.title: Why Are Many New York Apartments Empty? Rent Laws.
item.description: One in 10 buildings with rent-regulated apartments is losing money.

item.title: Trump Is Raising Billions in Federal Funds. That’s Not a Good Thing.
item.description: President Trump is raking in billions of dollars, bypassing Congress and the law.

item.title: A Doctor’s Guide to Using A.I. for Better Health
item.description: It’s natural to use A.I. to find answers to health questions. Here’s how to do it responsibly and safely.

item.title: What Pigeons Can Teach Us About Our Phone Fixation
item.description: The things that we desire are not always the things that give us satisfaction.

item.title: What Does Body Positivity Mean in This New Weight Loss Era?
item.description: Can you love your body and still want to lose weight?

item.title: There’s a Better Way to Stop Price Gouging
item.description: Zohran Mamdani has a chance to show how to tackle the problem.

item.title: Trump Risks Igniting a Nuclear Wildfire
item.description: The president’s approach to the rising nuclear danger is alarming.

item.title: Confessions of a Former Body Positivity Influencer
item.description: The body positivity movement is at a crossroads. What does loving yourself at any size mean now that weight loss is becoming more accessible than ever, thanks to GLP-1s? Can you still be body positive while wanting to lose weight? The former body positivity influencer Gabriella Lascano argues that the movement has lost its way and taken an extreme turn in recent years. But she says there’s a middle ground that still champions self-love and bodily autonomy while redefining them.

item.title: Why I Never Want to Have My Own Place
item.description: The secret to parenting is a baby monitor and 18 friends.

item.title: Democrats Can’t Leave School Choice to Republicans
item.description: Our education system is failing, but allotting funding by student and family preference, rather than by ZIP code, can help.

item.title: Pam Bondi and the MAGA Brand of Insult Politics
item.description: Insult everyone. Answer for nothing.

item.title: An Alternative to the Supreme Court’s Originalism
item.description: Outside of law school classrooms, the liberal constitutional agenda is failing. Enter the American Constitution Society.

item.title: The War in Ukraine Has Become a Way of Life
item.description: The war in Ukraine can look like the future and the past at once. But it’s just our present, the only one Ukrainians know.

item.title: The Olympics Take Themselves Too Seriously. Bring Back Ski Ballet.
item.description: You want at least one weird entree on the Olympics menu, even if only for the pleasure of not ordering it.

item.title: Toward a Sane Christian Zionism
item.description: Toward a sane Christian Zionism.

item.title: Why Harry Potter Still Inspires Us
item.description: Reader disagree with a guest essay that argued that the books feel dated and irrelevant today. Also: What A.I. can’t do in medicine.

item.title: Confessions of a Former Body Positivity Influencer
item.description: Can you love your body and still want to lose weight?

item.title: What It Means to Hold Someone’s Attention With a Story
item.description: Learning about our family’s past can connect us to the turmoil and difference that have always been America’s story.

item.title: Ro Khanna Is Shaken by What He’s Learned From the Epstein Files
item.description: Epstein’s network may not have known everything, but it is hard to deny that many of them knew enough to know better.

item.title: The Depravity of Trump’s Immigrant Detention
item.description: The president’s immigration dragnet is vicious but not surprising.

item.title: How Feeding the Baby Can Affect Your Marriage
item.description: Readers discuss a guest essay asserting that formula promotes marriage equality. Also: Ethics and the Supreme Court.

item.title: There’s a Reason American Kids Are Such Picky Eaters
item.description: Blame junk food.

item.title: Welcome to the Voyage of the Damned
item.description: The tech heroes turned zeros are leading us to our doom.

item.title: Pam Bondi’s ‘Cage Match’ and Trump’s Fraying Coalition
item.description: The round table reflects on a chaotic week of incompetence and meltdowns.
